body:
Hey @michaelem, from a quick look at your tests (I might be wrong), it seems like you're using the _should_-syntax as opposed to the _expect_-syntax RSpec [introduced some time ago](http://rspec.info/blog/2012/06/rspecs-new-expectation-syntax/) and recommends to use. It's quite easy to [switch to this syntax](https://github.com/rspec/rspec-expectations/blob/master/Should.md) though.
If your browser is not used to it, googling for the syntax tends to bring you to the old docs.... [these](https://www.relishapp.com/rspec/rspec-expectations/docs/built-in-matchers) are the current ones 🙈 

I think using _expect_ is best practice (see [here](http://betterspecs.org/#expect)), so more people are used to reading it like this.
